intro: Junellia scabridoglandulosa, commonly known as the rough glandular junellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories.
